messages.subject: Re: Inspirational books
messages.msgSnippet: Hi Stephanie These are a few of the books I have read, other than Sandra s =) which I personally found to be inspirational also... Rue Kream s Parenting a
messages.messageBody:
Hi Stephanie

These are a few of the books I have read, other than Sandra's =) which I personally found to be inspirational also...


Rue Kream's 'Parenting a Free Child - An Unschooled Life' (Easy to read and enjoy another families journey).
http://www.amazon.com/Parenting-Free-Child-Unschooled-Life/dp/1411641558
or directly
http://www.freechild.info/


Jan Fortune-Wood 'Winning Parent, Winning Child - Parenting so that everybody wins' (Very good at helping you think!! Well, it helped me think about my own automated responses to children and helped unblock some of my muddiness).
http://www.amazon.com/Winning-Parent-Child-Jan-Fotune-Wood/dp/0954943309/ref=ntt_at_ep_dpi_4
She has other books too (I havne't read any others though) if you click on her name they should show up in amazon.


The Unschooling Unmanual (A compilation of unschoolers experiences - easy to read and joyful).
http://www.amazon.com/Unschooling-Unmanual-Nanda-Van-Gestel/dp/0968575455


All the best
Natarsha

messages.subject: Re: Inspirational books
messages.msgSnippet: Of course Sandra s books are at the top of my list:) There s also: Parenting a Free Child by Rue Kream Julie v.
messages.messageBody:
Of course Sandra's books are at the top of my list:)

There's also:

'Parenting a Free Child' by Rue Kream

Julie v.



--- In AlwaysLearning@yahoogroups.com, "bellumswife77" <stefanie@...> wrote:
>
> I am a bookworm and am looking for books on Unschooling and an Unschooling lifestyle.
>
> I have read several minibooks on my Kindle, but nothing all that great. (Sandra Dodd, PLEASE have you book put into an eReader format! (Sandra Dodds book is next on my list)and I'm currently reading 'the unschooling handbook' 'real lives' and 'kids are worth it' by Barbara Coloroso.
>
>
>
> A few things that are basic in her book are.
>
> I will not treat a child in a way I myself would not want to be treated. If I wouldn't want it done to me, I have no business doing it to a child
>
> In everything we do, we need to leave a child's dignity intact.
>
> Anyhow, great reading for someone who is learning to change their way of thinking....
>
> Years ago I read a book written by an autodidact, a teen girl, not Grace Llewellyn and I can't remember the title. Anyhow, looking for books, thanks!
>
> Blessings,
> Stefanie in Alaska
>

messages.subject: Inspirational books
messages.msgSnippet: I am a bookworm and am looking for books on Unschooling and an Unschooling lifestyle. I have read several minibooks on my Kindle, but nothing all that great.
messages.messageBody:
I am a bookworm and am looking for books on Unschooling and an Unschooling lifestyle.

I have read several minibooks on my Kindle, but nothing all that great. (Sandra Dodd, PLEASE have you book put into an eReader format! (Sandra Dodds book is next on my list)and I'm currently reading 'the unschooling handbook' 'real lives' and 'kids are worth it' by Barbara Coloroso.



A few things that are basic in her book are.

I will not treat a child in a way I myself would not want to be treated. If I wouldn't want it done to me, I have no business doing it to a child

In everything we do, we need to leave a child's dignity intact.

Anyhow, great reading for someone who is learning to change their way of thinking....

Years ago I read a book written by an autodidact, a teen girl, not Grace Llewellyn and I can't remember the title. Anyhow, looking for books, thanks!

Blessings,
Stefanie in Alaska
